intro: Trichosanthes neoguineana, commonly known as the African horned melon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky, green fruit that turns orange when ripe. The plant belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals, and it produces both male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is edible, though its sharp, bumpy exterior requires careful handling.
